Venue availability: Finding the right venue for the festival may be challenging, especially if it has to accommodate a large number of attendees and screenings.
Programming: Selecting the right films for the festival can be difficult, especially if the organizers want to cater to a diverse audience.
Marketing: Promoting the festival to attract attendees and sponsors can be a challenge, especially if the festival is new or competing with other events.
Technical difficulties: Technical issues such as projector malfunctions, sound problems, and internet connectivity issues can disrupt the screening of films.
Staffing: Hiring and managing a team of volunteers or staff can be challenging, especially if the festival attracts a large number of attendees.
